description:
In case flavor information is not present in sysmeta then GET/PUT server response can have flavor as empty object.

ref- http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#n252

Having that mentioned in api-ref will be nice to understand it clearly.
title: api-ref: flavor information in server response can be empty

comments.content:
In case flavor information is not present in sysmeta then GET/PUT server response can have flavor as empty object.

ref- http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#n252

Having that mentioned in api-ref will be nice to understand it clearly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ghanshyammann

comments.content:

commit af1734b0dd6000e85f765c0084c8c8718ecfc10d
Author: ghanshyam <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Mar 31 07:35:17 2017 +0000

    Add empty flavor object info in server api-ref
    
    In case flavor information is not present in sysmeta then
    GET/PUT server response can have flavor as empty object.
    
    ref- http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#n252
    
    Having that mentioned in api-ref will be nice to understand it clearly.
    Closes-Bug: #1677999
    
    Change-Id: I350dc33df0cb03eb86df1f142e58ae34b02a1334
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 16.0.0.0b1 development milestone.
